meanings.definition: To come together in a group or crowd.
meanings.sent1: The birds were congregating on the power lines.
meanings.sent2: People were congregating in the park for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The ants were congregating around the fallen cookie.
meanings.sent4: Dark clouds were congregating in the sky, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The students were congregating in the library to study for their exams.

meanings.definition: The act of gathering together in a group.
meanings.sent1: The congregating of fans at the concert created a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The congregating of family members at the reunion was heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: The congregating of toys in the playroom made it look messy.
meanings.sent4: The congregating of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The congregating of bees around the hive was a busy scene.
